verses.esv: 32 Be kind to one another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, as God in Christ forgave you.
verses.kjv: 32 And be ye kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, even as God for Christ’s sake hath forgiven you.
verses.niv: 32 Be kind and compassionate to one another, forgiving each other, just as in Christ God forgave you.

verses.esv: 2 It would be better for him if a millstone were hung around his neck and he were cast into the sea than that he should cause one of these little ones to sin.
verses.kjv: 2 It were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck, and he cast into the sea, than that he should offend one of these little ones.
verses.niv: 2 It would be better for him to be thrown into the sea with a millstone tied around his neck than for him to cause one of these little ones to sin.

verses.esv: 17:1 And he said to his disciples, “Temptations to sin are sure to come, but woe to the one through whom they come!
verses.kjv: 1 Then said he unto the disciples, It is impossible but that offences will come: but woe unto him, through whom they come!
verses.niv: 1 Jesus said to his disciples: "Things that cause people to sin are bound to come, but woe to that person through whom they come.

verses.esv: 23 “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you tithe mint and dill and cumin, and have neglected the weightier matters of the law: justice and mercy and faithfulness. These you ought to have done, without neglecting the others. 24 You blind guides, straining out a gnat and swallowing a camel!
verses.kjv: 23 Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye pay tithe of mint and anise and cummin, and have omitted the weightier matters of the law, judgment, mercy, and faith: these ought ye to have done, and not to leave the other undone. 24 Ye blind guides, which strain at a gnat, and swallow a camel.
verses.niv: 23 "Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You give a tenth of your spices--mint, dill and cummin. But you have neglected the more important matters of the law--justice, mercy and faithfulness. You should have practiced the latter, without neglecting the former. 24 You blind guides! You strain out a gnat but swallow a camel.

verses.esv: 8 Be sober-minded; be watchful. Your adversary the devil prowls around like a roaring lion, seeking someone to devour.
verses.kjv: 8 Be sober, be vigilant; because your adversary the devil, as a roaring lion, walketh about, seeking whom he may devour:
verses.niv: 8 Be self-controlled and alert. Your enemy the devil prowls around like a roaring lion looking for someone to devour.

verses.esv: 17 Repay no one evil for evil, but give thought to do what is honorable in the sight of all.
verses.kjv: 17 Recompense to no man evil for evil. Provide things honest in the sight of all men.
verses.niv: 17 Do not repay anyone evil for evil. Be careful to do what is right in the eyes of everybody.

verses.esv: 7 “Blessed are the merciful, for they shall receive mercy.
verses.kjv: 7 Blessed are the merciful: for they shall obtain mercy.
verses.niv: 7 Blessed are the merciful, for they will be shown mercy.

verses.esv: 13 I can do all things through him who strengthens me.
verses.kjv: 13 I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.
verses.niv: 13 I can do everything through him who gives me strength.

verses.esv: 19 Beloved, never avenge yourselves, but leave it to the wrath of God, for it is written, “Vengeance is mine, I will repay, says the Lord.”
verses.kjv: 19 Dearly beloved, avenge not yourselves, but rather give place unto wrath: for it is written, Vengeance is mine; I will repay, saith the Lord.
verses.niv: 19 Do not take revenge, my friends, but leave room for God's wrath, for it is written: "It is mine to avenge; I will repay," says the Lord.

verses.esv: 4 And falling to the ground, he heard a voice saying to him, “Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me?”
verses.kjv: 4 And he fell to the earth, and heard a voice saying unto him, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?
verses.niv: 4 He fell to the ground and heard a voice say to him, "Saul, Saul, why do you persecute me?"
